column4: I'm having a big problem trying to mount a windows share from command line, I keep getting: mount error 13 = Permission denied
I KNOW my credentials are correct
ran it with sudo?
I have to
it won't even let me run it without
mount: only root can do that
my command: sudo mount //192.168.1.170/c$ ./smb_share/ -t cifs -o username=andrew,password=123456
can you ping the other computer in lan?
yup
do you have sambafs installed?
sry smbfs
[34250.008242] Status code returned 0xc000006d NT_STATUS_LOGON_FAILURE
[34250.008253] CIFS VFS: Send error in SessSetup = -13
[34250.008262] CIFS VFS: cifs_mount failed w/return code = -13
(and yes I do)
(That's a dmesg | tail )
same error if I substitute mount.cifs for mount -t cifs
tried mounting it with -t smbfs?
I've tried, same error
how dos your credential file look like?
as far as I know, I'm not using one
as I said before
my command: sudo mount //192.168.1.170/c$ ./smb_share/ -t cifs -o username=andrew,password=123456
any idea/
